name: NPR
text:
China has seized on protests sparked by George Floyd's death to spread propaganda about what it calls American "double standards."
https://t.co/b7jtV0Wa0V

name: NPR
text:
Millions of people are having to skip payments on mortgages, auto loans and other bills.

But programs aimed at helping still aren't reaching many people who need it — and many homeowners have been given wrong or misleading information from lenders.
https://t.co/DUmOXbrNle

name: NPR
text: More than 50 years after his death, Martin Luther King Jr.'s words still carry visceral power — and they've taken on renewed significance throughout the demonstrations across the nation in response to the killing of George Floyd. https://t.co/tQsVyHtrdZ

name: NPR
text:
Barack Obama: "Just remember, this country was founded on protest ... every step of progress in this country, every expansion of freedom, every expression of our deepest ideals has been won through efforts that made the status quo uncomfortable."
https://t.co/4wWOItz5Zl

name: NPR
text:
Gary Jones, the former president of the United Auto Workers union, has admitted he conspired to embezzle more than $1 million of union money, in addition to pleading guilty to racketeering and tax evasion. 
https://t.co/ScpQymKXJC

name: NPR
text:
David McAtee, the owner of Yaya's BBQ in Louisville, was shot and killed by police and National Guard on Monday.

He is remembered as a "community pillar."

"He fed everybody," his nephew said. "Fed everybody, even the people that killed him. For free."
https://t.co/yjK0yRFTNe
